answers.answer: They won't do it. Only if u have complications that won't allow u to deliver vaginally.
It never hurts to ask after all it is ur baby and ur body and should be ur decision I think it depends on ur doctor
There can also be complications with c section i think your body will decide when the time comes and your doctor will know what to do

Being a teen mom has nothing to do with anything, there's many teens that deliver vaginally. I understand that you just don't want to have to go through the pain . But, although I was a teen mom at 16 years of age , they still made me SUFFER through the pain before they found out I had SEVERE preeclampsia & then made me have an Emergency Cesarean. If there's nothing wrong with you, you'll have to have a vaginal birth . I know many stories that people bring to you may scare you into thinking a vaginal birth is horrible & scary . But, if there's little girls pushing out babies then I know any mother can do it!(: gl sweety.

Umm..that doesn't make sense.  Babies don't breathe air until they are born.naturally is the safest for both mom and baby unless an emergency.  C section is major abdominal surgery and has can have a lot more problems after. My mom hemorrhaged with a c section.  That doesn't always happen, but its really safest vaginally.  And honestly its not excruciating. I loved it. And with a c section you don't get all the mommy hormones your suppose to have with giving birth

Most likely your doctor won't do a c section only because you request it. Honestly, the risks with a c section are much greater than vaginal birth in my opinion(major abdominal surgery vs what nature intended for our bodies to do). Yes, bad things can happen, but that stuff can happen either way, and giving birth is what us ladies are built for. It's scary to think about, but when the time comes, your body knows what to do, and a c section should definitely be a last resort. I would definitely read up on both, and gather as much information as possible before so that you can make the best decision possible for you. Good luck (:

I'm high risk , and they still need air they breathe but they gets theirs through the umbilical cord and I am very small my baby is big another reason  . Im not saying being a teen affects if I can deliver it effects my choice in the matter

What makes you high risk? I'm small and had an amlost 9lbs baby. Your size really doesn't mean anything. Doctors will tell you it does, but its not true. You might need to do different positions though. I was on my hands and knees. If I was on my back it would have been pretty difficult
My hospital won't do different positions ,& my baby might have a cmv infection which can cause alot of complications. Well my baby's head is big
My hospital won't do different positions ,& my baby might have a cmv infection which can cause alot of complications. Well my baby's head is big
My baby might have an infection which can cause a lot of issues I just dont want him to get hurt or not make it . I'm just really scared :(

It sounds like you are making up excuses now, one minute you mention one thing & the next its another . If your doctor felt you needed an cesarean he or she would have mentioned it before it ever came to your mind . They are the firsts to really know! Also, this is a matter you should be discussing with your doctor anyway, we don't know what kind of risk your baby is prone to .

I agree with My2LoveBugs.. You have probley heard a bunch of negative stories about labor and you are scared. My sons head was huge and I had no problem with delivery. If your Dr is concerned that you may need a c section he will schedule one.. This is what our bodies are made for and you got this. When you are in labor having a baby trust me you find out that you are stronger than you think

trust me, you don't want a c section unless you have to have one! it really *****, super painful, long recovery time! I've Never heard of a doctor doing a c section BC someone just decided they want one. if something happens in labor they will do a c section so I wouldn't worry too much, a lot of it is probably your hormones. just stay calm and the doctors will be watching the baby the entire time you are in labor. you will do great! I would much rather have the experience of having my baby naturally then having it taken away BC there's a problem. I would give anything to have my next baby vbac and I think when the time comes you will be ready

I'm not making up excuses I'm scared  all these other girls who delivered natural had some type of issue during labor and knowing my baby is high risk I wanna do whatever means he will be ok & in my opinion thay seems like a c-section. Idk about me hurting me taking a long time to recover i just dont wanna lose my baby I'm really scared.

Having a vaginal birth is better than a c section in some ways and vice versa... If your concern is breathing then a vaginal birth is better because the birth canal squeezes the mucus out of the baby's lung and that doesn't happen in a c section...I have had two c sections... Will be having my third in 9 weeks... The best thing to do is to let nature take its course and try not to worry... Don't let another labor scare you... All are different... When you get yourself upset it affects the baby and cause him or her distress

Baby girl if your baby is high risk it wouldn't matter if it comes out vaginaly or threw c-section whatever way he or she comes out won't be safer than the other and if anything woman that have a c-section have complications because they have to REALY TAKE CARE of themselves since they can get infections and reopen the cut or bleed to much during the c-section. It takes them longer to recover! & about the air most baby's do struggle to breath not because of how they were delivered but because it's the first time they breath! They have to learn. I'm gona be a teen mom to and even though I'm scared out of my mind about giving birth I'm choosing to go all natural! I honestly don't think a doctor would give you a c-section just because you don't want to have it normal but you could ask after all your gona pay for it.Good Luck

You won't lose your baby or the baby having problems by giving birth through the birth canal. I agree with these women that everyone is different and each person goes through it differently but that doesnt mean you will go through what they did. Just because your small that doesn't mean anything. The birthing canal will dilate enough for the baby to go through. Many women give birth naturally with no problems. Don't be scared. A C - section only happens when there's something wrong. And your baby will be healthy with no infections
I personally loved my labor lol I know not a lot of women say that. But I had a home water birth and it was just so stress free. Your bodyknows what to Do to ddeliver your baby. Just trust it
Its whatever you want to do. If you feel that you really need to have a csection talk with your doctor about your concerns and see what he/she might suggest.
the only way you will have a csec is if you are having complications and cant deliver natural. or maybe if you feel like paying ouult of pocket for it then maybe they might.

question: Everyone says it's better to do natural but honestly I just want them to take him out quick cause everyone having their babies naturally are having complactions with their baby not getting enough air and stuff so can tell my doctor I want a c-section?? I'm a teen mom this is my first baby
title: Can you choose to have a c-section ?
